reviewText: This pillow cover is very soft and silky.  Protects you hair and skin-is not wrinkle free after washing-it requires ironing.

We have just had a major remodel of our bathroom due to needing handicap shower.  This shower curtain was longerand did not work with the narrow edge of the shower.  I would like it and would have kept it had it met our needs.The colors are clean and bright. Shades of green look well with browns or fall colors.
summary: Beautiful shower curtain with shades of green

reviewText: I make tons of pickles every summer, and really dread the heat and steam of a hot water bath canner.  This steam canner only uses 2 quarts of water and much less energy to get up to steam.  It heats quickly and efficiently.  I sterilized jars in it and steam canned 2 batches of pickles yesterday.  So wonderful!  I did process the quarts 5 minutes longer than the HWB time.  Also, I think I will only put 5 quarts in at one time, instead of six.  It will hold six quarts, but all the jars are jammed together.  Still love it and look forward to many many more batches of pickles!  Would definitely buy again, and recommend it highly.
summary: I love this Victorio Steam Canner!

reviewText: I am really happy with this purchase.  It does seem to be warmer than it should.  When a recipe calls for low, I put this on warm.  When the recipe calls for high heat, I put this on low.

Being only four feet eleven inches in height, my hands sometimes have difficulty with larger glasses so I tried these out for size and found them ideal. It is true I have to refill them during the hot months of Tucson but they are much sturdier than regular plastic disposables and so will hold up just fine. I like the green, yellow and orange flowers and the leaves as they brighten up the day. The fact the glasses are square rather than round makes them unique and does not detract from their purpose of holding liquids. I am afraid I do not drink hot liquids so I cannot rate them on that aspect. I can only say the six glasses were a good deal in price and quality and I am pleased with my choice.
summary: A Really Nice Size for a Small Adult

reviewText: I wanted to be cranky and dislike these bowls. My old mixing bowls were old trusted friends, even if they were heavy, very heavy. These bowls were light and even, the horror, flexed a bit. And why did I need three nesting colanders?Well, after living with this bowl set for several months, I can say I use them everyday and I love them. I gave my old bowl set to one of my kids, I called it a early inheritance gift because my 401K is still barely breathing.I didn't think the weight difference would be significant, but it is. I don't know anyone with the counter space to store mixing bowls out in the open.  It is so much easier to pull this bowl set out of whatever crevice they're stored in. I keep my bowls on a low shelf and I can pull the set out with one hand. That's convenient.Actually using the bowls was another pleasant surprise. The bowls have a slight flex and "give" when you hold them to your body  while mixing. Not a lot, but just enough to feel like the bowl is moulding itself to you. I know that last sentence sounds a bit silly. I felt silly writing it. But give these bowls a try.The cover is a waste of plastic. The bowls are made to have the colanders nest inside, but the cover doesn't fit with the large colander nested in the bowl. Did OXO actually have two design teams, one for bowls/colanders and another for the cover and they didn't talk to each other? How big is OXO the design center?
summary: So superior, I gave away a perfectly good set of mixing bowls

reviewText: Right off the bat I could see that this was going to be a great little kitchen accessory. I have a lot of Oxo stuff and love it all.I have to be honest though, I was kind of hoping this would replace my mandolin.I have the Oxo Mandolin and while I love it, it's a pain in the tukas to break it down and put it back together every time.This little mini slicer/grater works kind of like a mandolin in that you set up the blade in the bowl (it locks in really easily) and then use a gripper to slide your victim back and forth across it until you have what you want.It's shreds carrots really nicely, kinda like your house salads in a restaurant. Everything is very sharp and pretty effortless.It grates cheese like a standard grater but turned on it's side so it's easier and it has a little measuring bowl to catch it all which I also love. Everything breaks down and goes into the washer easily, it stores really nicely.It's a genius little kit and I definitely recommend it.So then my disappointments were based of some preconceptions from the pictures and experience with other Oxo products.It's not going to replace your mandolin first of all. It could to some degree if they make different inserts with some other thicknesses, but as it is right now you get super thin slices and that's it. You're not going to be slicing tomatoes, julienne fries or anything with it.I guess you could slice potatoes to fry up some chips but they will be really thin. I wanna say it's like 1/16th, I tried to make apple chips for my daughter with it and they came out paper thin. Would be great for cheese slices though.The cheese grater is just a standard grater. What blows me away about this is I have an Oxo grater that grates in both directions, it's brilliant, seriously. This thing would be perfect for the dual direction grater and instead it's just a standard grater. It really makes no sense. After using the Oxo grater for so long now this was kind of frustrating, especially since I'm already making the back and forth action with the gripper.But as far as complaints that's all I've got.I love this set, it's another great idea from Oxo, I'll probably ditch my current cheese grater for it, maybe... I really like that thing. But this set breaks down, cleans up and stores so much easier.It's not the epic kitchen tool I thought it would be when it came up for review and I'm seriously stumped at how they could leave out the obvious features found in their other cheese grater, but it is definitely worth having in the kitchen for quick prep work without a lot of fuss.One more blade with a 1/8 or 3/16 depth would've sealed the deal for me. That would've made this a must have item.I'm definitely keeping it and I've already used it quite a few times.Just wish it did a little more.
summary: Sweet little set. A couple gripes though.

reviewText: It says that this frame will fit for 20 by 27 pictures etc. so I bought two for my 20 by 27 puzzles. However, it turns out this frame actually is smaller. The 20 inch dimension is OK, just fit the 20 inch dimension of my puzzles. While the 27 inch dimension actually is only 26.4 inches, which makes it impossible for my 20 by 27 puzzles!
summary: it DOESN'T fit for (it's smaller) 20 by 27 pictures!!!!

reviewText: Pros:-good capacity, holds 16oz-if you drop it, doesn't break-rubber at the bottom grips well so it doesn't move around your desk or cupholderCons:-gets hot to the touch with hot beverages-can't see through to see how much coffee you have left
Nice glasses and are required when drinking Stella, yes?  I hand wash and keep them chilled in the refrigerator. That's all I have to say.

The other reviews here seem hyperbolic. How could something this simple work that well and please so many? Add Mrs. Spudman and me to the list of Progressive Can Colander fans.  The colander works superbly with tuna and equally as well on canned foods like pineapple or olives. Using the can lid to drain as we had always done before is a messy chore, and there's always the possibility of cutting yourself on the sharp edge of the metal lid.For tuna press the aerated bottom against the tuna and press down with the convenient handles. You get tuna that's not soggy and dry fingers. Fabulous.For some foods you can invert the colander and use it as a simple drainer and more like a little colander.You can even use it the sift flour onto the countertop before rolling out pastry dough.We are very satisfied with this handy kitchen accessory. Progressive offers a satisfaction guarantee too on this made in China wonder.
This product is what it promises to be.  I like the number of hooks and I am glad I did not buy a set with fewer of them. The finish is nice and shiny.

These cups have enough weight to them to know they are sturdy.  I don't think I'll ever need to replace them.  I bought a bread machine recently and did not have good measuring cups (like I had a plastic set with a couple of the sizes missing!).  So I am using these very happily to measure bread ingredients as well for other baking.

I purchased this to grind dried herbs, pappercorns and instant tapioca (used to thicken juice of berries in pies).  It takes a lot of effort to grind sufficient quantities (which is extremely difficult if you have arthritic hands) and as you grind it tightens the lid which is next to impossible to twist off when you are done grinding. I did find that the grinder part will unscrew easier if you wrap a rubber band around the threads.  I will be looking for a different grinder.  The cost on this is, also, high for this item.

Ordered this percolator based upon the description as stainless steel design and a review that stated that there are no plastic parts that come into contact with the coffee. Well, the lid is plastic and the coffee percolates up and would constantly hit the lid. I wanted a percolator that has no plastic to contaminate the coffee - this is not it. Had to return it. (Pot seems sturdy and well made otherwise)
just what i ordered and have used it and it is great.  the mini loaveswere  hit at church.  was told it was just the right size for dessert

reviewText: I love these things. I purchased these to organize my pantry better and keep cereals and crackers fresher longer. They are very room but don't take up much space in the pantry, which I love. They lids are easy to attach and un-attach and hold up well in the dishwasher. It has a nice grip handle which makes it easier for kids and women with smaller hands. Really would recommend this product.

We have been using this filter for our well water supply since before we lived here -- the previous owners of our home used this brand, too.  You can change the filter once a year or once every six months depending how it looks when you change it.  The first time I saw the "old" filter it had a thin film of light colored mud on it. Recently, maybe because we had had no rain for several months, there was just sand/gravel at the bottom - our well is 260 feet down. This filter screens out to 5 microns.  This way you don't see gravel or other items in your faucet water.  You use a plastic "wrench" to open up the filter housing to replace your filter.  It is fast and easy and nice to have something that screens out physical impurities like dirt and rock.  We have been using these filters for 6 years.
summary: Aqua-Pure Whole House Water Filter - Screens to 5 microns

reviewText: This brush did not come with my machine, but I bought it at the same time. The power brush that came with my Miele was very difficult to roll across thick carpet. I realize that "vacuum" requires real suction, but the SEB236 is much easier to push and pull across carpet.Unlike the brush that came with my machine, the SEB236 can be locked into a full standing position so the brush doesn't have to be laid down or held up by the machine when you want to pause or stop vacuuming.On the downside, the brush is extremely heavy.  Carrying it up and down stairs isn't fun.  Still, it does an amazing job, is easier to roll, has bright headlights and can be locked in the upright position when not in use.In my opinion, this brush and the parquet floor brush are essential accessories for a Miele canister vac.
Great shelf. I use three of these in the fridge. They spin well, and hold a fair amount of stuff. They're easy to clean too.

reviewText: Having just chosen a new French door refrigerator specifically because it did not dispense through the door, I realized that I would need an ice scoop.As soon as I did a search, theOXO Good Grips Scoop, Translucent Whitejumped out at me since I have been so pleased with other OXO products. The only problem with this waffle iron is that it make much better waffles than mine! :) Getting myself one. Highly recommend it!

I have owned this for about 5 years and I think it is about time I wrote a review for it, especially since I have been recently using it, almost, on a daily basis.I am a big fan of minimalism/simplicity when it comes to drinking wine. Though I have accumulated a whole load of accessories, I tend to find most pleasure and function using my simpleGulliver Two Step Waiter's Corkscrew - Burgundy, mySchott Zwiesel Tritan Crystal Glass Stemware Cru Classic Collection Bordeaux, 27.9-Ounce, Set of 6, aWine Enthusiast Vivid Wine Decanterand my Vacu Vin Concerto.The Vacu Vin is among the simplest, fool-proof wine savers available. Place the high-quality, all rubber constructed stopper on the bottle, press down, place the pump on the stopper and keep working the plunger till you hear 2 clicks. The click indicator ensures that you do not overwork and ruin the plastic constructed pump.I have used the pump for about 5 years and sealed 125+ bottles and it still works just as well as the first day I got it. I generally drink my wine within 3-5 days of sealing. The reason I thought of writing a review after all these years is that I drank a bottle of California red  last night that had been sealed and stored about 4 weeks ago. The wine tasted awesome! Same flavor profile with even more rounded tannins. If this was a cabernet created to last the ages, I would not have thought much of it, but it was an inexpensive bottle (~$20 retail) created to  be drunk almost right after bottling.  And the cherry on top was that there was only about 5 ounces remaining in the bottle. In full disclosure, I store all my bottles in my wine refrigerator after sealing.To avoid stoppers from staining and smelling, I would advise to hand-wash and air dry immediately after use. I have never washed the pump - just keep it and spare stoppers in a Ziploc bag.Highly Recommended!Pros:* Works as advertised* Simplicity in Design* Well-constructed* AffordableCons:* Will stain and smell if left unwashed
summary: Save Your Wine For Another Day!

reviewText: The rivets that hold the handle onto the piston give way and become loose, causing the handle to wobble and eventually become unusable, typical of items made in China. This happened after about the first 60 pecans I cracked.  I knew this was a problem, since I have had two other crackers like this one, and so I was being careful when I used it. The solution is to search for a nut and bolt to fit the hole, or drill the rivet out and replace it - not exactly what one wants to do when there are 3 five gallon buckets of pecans waiting to be cracked.  I make the crackers last as long as I can, but it would be nice it they were made more substantially from the beginning. Duke needs to move his company back to the USA.The design of the nutcracker is fine.  I would gladly pay more money if a stronger and more substantial metal was used.
I'm impressed with this pan. I've been using it for about 6 months now. It's thick and heavy duty. It hasn't warped or discolored and the lid fits tightly. Best of all it's made in the U.S.

I was pleased when the skillet arrived to find it was fairly heavy duty with a sturdy handle and lid.  The non-stick surface is so smooth that food browns very evenly. The pan was easy to clean and maintain with warm soapy water and a dish towel.

Even if you have a self cleaning oven, it seem as if the oven gets soiled again right after 2 hours of cleaning time.  With this liner, a spill is a simple clean up.  Just wipe off and you're done, a few minutes.

Despite some of the bad experiences I've had with pre-seasoned skillets that didn't have a very good seasoning on them, this one was actually pretty good.  It's held up for quite a while and the seasoning (original+time added) provides better non-stick cooking than my Teflon coated pans.It also does a great job evening out the pan's temperature.  Since I have an awful electric cook top, this is a must-have for me.  Finally I can cook up hand-made pirogies without having half of them burn before the other half is cooked at all.
summary: One of the few pre-seasoned cast iron cookware items that doesn't suck!

reviewText: My entire house has hardwood floors except for my dining room. I have a 4 year old full size Dyson vacuum that I have been using, but it is pretty big just to use for one room. I have been wanting a Dyson that would be small and easy to store.The Dyson DC35 Animal Digital Slim Cordless Vacuum is such a great size! It is thin, light-weight, and hangs on the wall when not in use. The suction is amazing. I have a dog and it vacuumed up all the hair and dirt off the floor. I charged it all night before using and the charge lasted through the entire room - 10 feet x 12 feet. This is the perfect vacuum for small spaces.I have tried many cordless vacs and they never have much suction - the Dyson is amazing and lives up to its promises.As an added bonus I am able to vacuum areas of my hardwood floors as well. This vacuum is well worth the price and the two year warranty is great!

We have had several different mixers over the last 48 years, but never one that does the job as well as this one.  I bought the larger one with the thought that it is possible to have one that is too small requiring mixing several batches.  This size makes that unnecessary for anything that we mix.  Oh, yes, it is made in America also.

Let me preface this review by saying that I bought these because I lost one of my measuring spoons from another set - they had a plastic ring that connected them all together, but over time the ring loosened.These magnetic ones are perfect!! They stay together in my silverware drawer and are so tidy, compared to my old set which was always splayed out all over the place.Also, the two different shapes of measuring spoons in this set is helpful - the narrower size is great for getting into narrow spice jars.I would recommend these to anyone.

the spatula blades are abut the same size as any good spatula. The wonderful saving grace of these are the handles. The are strong, confortable and with the molded in scraper very durable. Recommended buy.

reviewText: Overall, I would recommend this garbage can. I like the motion sensor, especially since I have a baby and have my hands full a lot. It also locks the bad smells in to the garbage can so you can't smell it just walking by. My only problem is that you have like 2 seconds to throw something out before it automatically closes. If you want to scrape something out you have to press open and then press close when you're done.
Well made, great color. And with so many matching pieces. We use it everyday. Stands up well, no chipping even thou I use some as doggie dishes!

I have tried various meringue powders and hands-down, the Ateco one is the best ! It is the only one I use now.First of all, it is the best tasting. It sort of tastes like marshmallow. No clear vanilla extract needed.  My only caveatis that I have found it is best to use slightly LESS than what the standard recipe calls for.  Most recipes for royal icingcalls for 5 TBSP of meringue powder.  Whenever I use the full amount, i get grainy royal icing! It literally looks and feelslike grains of white sugar.  However, if I use 4 TBSP, it makes the most wonderful, fluffy, shiny royal icing.  I whisk the meringue powder with 3/4 cup warm water. I then add whisk in 1 tsp cream of tartar (it helps it to harden). Then I dump 2.25 pounds (1 bag) of confectioner's sugar (I don't sift but you may want to) and beat on LOW for 8-10 minutes.  It is perfect every time! And yes, you can use fresh egg whites for royal icing but I don't want to risk the .01 chance of someone getting salmonella.

I use this steamer every evening after work to create healthy dishes that I love to eat.  My current favorite is chicken breast and lots of fresh vegetables (cabbage, carrot, mushrooms, green beans, etc).  This is a great way to get fast healthy meals.  Even when I am tired from working all day and battling traffic, I have energy to fix dinner in this steamer.  Any left over's go to work with me the next day and serve as lunch.  I feel more energetic and my stomach is flatter after two weeks of cooking exclusively with this steamer.  I am even thinking of buying a second steamer to steam larger amounts for holiday dishes (green beans, sweet potatoes, russet potatoes, etc).  Love it and you will too.  If on the fence, just get it! One of my co-workers just bought one from Amazon too!
This works really well!  I use it all the time.  There is no need to use oil and it cleans easily.

Woohoo!  I cut something with this knife!  It's awesome!  It's changed my life!Ok, seriously, it's a knife.  It cuts things.  It has a *nice* handle, doesn't get slippery when it gets wet...  just for that it's worth $$.  Best chef's knife I've ever used?  Sure, it's clearly superior to my Leatherman Wave (and my Topeak Alien, for that matter) for cutting fruits and bread, not to mention it totally blows away my previous #1 choice (X-Acto saw).  (Ever try to cut a cake with an X-Acto saw?  I did.  Bad.  Now try it with this one.  Good!)For a first kitchen it's a great choice...and it may just be the last chef's knife you ever need to buy.  It doesn't cost $$ but that's a good thing... I'd be pretty miserable knowing I spent $$ on a kitchen knife when I could've spent a lot less for a good sturdy knife like this one.

Keeps the butter fresh and the cat doesn't even look at it. I never had a problem of butter falling out or going bad and I live in a desert climate.
My family has had this can opener for over ten years. It still aligns perfectly and works well. I also love the bottle opener on the side!

I live at the beach, so I have a bit of a beach theme in our house. I wanted something ocean related to add to the décor. These canvas prints look great. I haven't hung them on the wall yet, still search for the best place. I'm very pleased with the quality and the way they look. Can't wait to get them on the wall.

Today I decided was the last day I was going to get splattered with flour using my old Oster hand mixer.  I spent a lot of time on Amazon checking reviews, looking for a mixer with slower speeds. I saw some complaints about this one's burst of power, but felt it was worth trying over a Kitchenaide which is pricier and appeared to have more quality complaints. This one also comes with a 3 year warranty, versus 1 year which made me feel more comfortable with the purchase. I made a batch of Toll House cookies right away to test it out. It is true that when it first turns on there is a burst of speed, but it only lasts for 2 seconds (I timed it). As long as you can hold off putting the beaters in the bowl for 2 seconds you will have a very slow setting which allows you to mix in flour with no splattering. I tested various speeds and found as the batter got thicker I  could go up to Speed 3 and still not have flour flying out of the bowl.  It has only been one day, but I'm quite happy with how it handles. I will update this in the future if problems arise.
You can do alot of this with it steam clean mop take out wrinkles in clothes. Have not experienced any problems. Great Product
What can I say? This Flask and funnel combo are just like peanut butter and jelly, they go together! Great for the game or anytime you want a nip!

But there are so many reasons they do not work for me.  I'll first say, I bake a lot and also have 4 and 5 year old girls.  I purchased based on the reviews and for the following reasons:Colors - I loved the idea they were different because I always get the 1/3 and 1/4 cup mixed up if I'm not paying attention.  Still love the concept.Collapsability - haven't used the feature because I found that after you wash them they take awhile to get dry in those crevices.  Plus, wasn't really concerned about space so much and you have to make sure they pop out the right way.Plastic - I'd had the hard KitchenAid plastic measuring cups before and prefer plastic with the kids.  Plastic on these is okay but forget it if you use anything in them that remotely has oil because they are then hard to clean.  I used one for Crisco and I am now sorry.Scoopability and measuring - I'll make up this new word because it is the main reason I am no online looking for some metal ones.  Because I bake I use a lot of flour and I find the edge on these to make it hard and you can't get as clean of a measurement when swiping the top (not that I'm that picky about measuing that way but I found it hard to even do a "best guess" with these).Hope this review helps others.  Overall, probably will work for many and I know my kids will enjoy using them.  But for me, back to looking at reviews for something else.
summary: Oh how I wanted to love these!

reviewText: Great holder of four movie dvds on one sheet. They handle my storage quite nicely.Being able to store one's dvds on shelves with easy access, IMO the only way to go.I just insert the movie pix in the sleeve sleeve and next the dvd, I'm ready for another.

Many enthusiasts precede me. Here's my honest review after testing this Cuissential Slim Digital Nutritional Food Scale with Precision Measuring. As most people have commented on the scale, this focuses more on the booklet than the product. (See note from Cuissential's "Andy" below in response to my comments.)First, I found the instruction book inadequate. Its listing of foods was weirdly categorized and oddly chosen. Second, I am also concerned that items like vegetable lasagna and cheesecake are listed when the nutritional composition of these, and many other foods included in the instruction book, can vary so widely. Third, illustrations are used to explain operation of the scale but even after a careful study I was confused and only managed how to figure out how to switch from metric measurement and weigh food items.I think it's a nice product and very useful for the simple weighing of food. The main issue is the attempt at an awkwardly translated booklet. It needed a better presentation to enhance the scale's potential. Perhaps clearer instructions and a more realistic approach regarding foods that vary nutritionally due to variation of preparation would much better support a fairly well-designed product.(P.S. I was provided this for review by the maker. I also reviewed the Cuissential Slickboil Collapsible Kettle from this same manufacturer.)
summary: How helpful is the booklet for using the scale?

reviewText: I love it! It really does what it say. I bought two one for my college son and one for me it works perfectly

OVERALL:  I am keeping this machine because it's a great carpet cleaner. It got the carpets cleaner than the professional cleaners and using a long hose with a wand attachment is not a back-breaker like upright home machines. Water filtration is superior to dry vacuuming with its smelly air and bags -- even with HEPA bags. There are features I loved...BUT THERE ARE FEATURES ABOUT THIS MACHINE THAT ARE AWFUL.  I'm giving the Big Green "Complete" Home-Cleaning System 7700 three stars for "incomplete." The hose/intake/filter selection assembly is really user unfriendly, to put it mildly. The manual is not helpful. Customer support is an oxymoron --or is just moronic?  Specific details below:Unit Assembly gets an "F" The assembly for the /hose door/hose connection/ filter selector is hard to use. Precious time should go into cleaning and not on trying to figure the darn thing out -- the manual is not at all helpful. The hose connection is also very difficult.  It requires a very strong hand to turn and the notch is hard to find. Same goes for the solution connector. If one only had to install this once, that would be fine, but the hose has to be removed and replaced every time you remove the collection tank, or when you change cleaning functions (e.g. dry vacuuming to wet cleaning). The quick-release door is useless because you still need to re-attach the hose each time you change the water in the collection tank.  The filter selection markings are inside the collection tank, which steams up so it can be difficult to see the settings insideCustomer service from the Philippines is an oxymoron (with emphasis on the last two syllables.)After taking all my contact information and the name and model of the a woman whose English I could not understand asked for the individual model number, which is under the machine.  I told her I could not access it because there was water in both the collection and solution tanks and I just had a simple question. She said answered to go ahead an turn the machine over.  I didn't follow her directions, obviously. Without the model number she would not help me -I never got an answer.Wet Carpet Cleaning gets an "A".  It has excellent extraction and cleans better than professional cleaning. Carpets dry quickly and the room smells very clean. However, when you turn off the machine make sure to turn the hose attachment up or dirty water pours out from the hose.Dry Carpet Cleaning a "B". The turbo carpet cleaner did a good job, but the attachment developed a very noisy rattle (like a screw that got loose.) I've only had this machine for a little over a week.Dry floor cleaning a "B".  Does the job.  The attachment has two levers -- w. brush or without--The levers are a good idea but be aware that because of the levers the attachment can't get under very low furniture. Water filtration is great, no odors dispersed into the air.Wet floor cleaning: "A" I used the micro cloth. This actually worked quite well and covered a large surface area quickly. Wide tile grout still needed a small toothbrush in spots, but overall this function is good.  Floors get really clean and the solution is fragrant. Attachments: "C" The turbo attachment developed a rattle the second time I used it. (Can't bear calling customer support again.) The attachments are very hard to release and take off.  This is not a new concept. Vacuum cleaner manufacturers figured this one out a long time ago, people. BBissell Corp. should get someone like Steve Jobs to really ride herd on Bissell's product design and customer support divisions and strive for excellence. If Bissell spent more effort on product development than marketing, it would not need to discount and pull its products. How can Bissell get this far on the concept and then blow it on critical details?
I'm very pleased with these tongs. They are sturdy enough to pick up heavy loads and precisely made for delicate work. I would definitely recommend it.

I was in the market for a toaster oven, and I prefer my appliances digital. I believe this is the cheapest digital toaster oven you will find. The style of the oven is pretty nice. It certainly looks more expensive than it is.Being digital has some neat advantages. First, when you toast something, you see a countdown timer based on your setting. And, very important, the oven will readjust the time if it's already hot! When you are baking or broiling the counter will count down from the time you choose.Another poster commented on a different toaster oven how superfluous it is for a toaster oven to have a clock (as in time of day). This one does too. There's no need for it besides keeping the LEDs entertained while you're not using the oven.  However, the digits are very clear, bright, and easy to read. I find it rather amusing that I have four appliance clocks in my kitchen and I find myself using the toaster oven's the most!Toasting bread: The oven comes with six settings for non-frozen bread and six settings for frozen bread. I'll usually set the average analog toaster a little under the half-way mark and I had heard toaster ovens don't toast as well as regular toasters, so I chose the 't3' setting (middle) the first time around. The bread came out burnt. Then I tried 't2'. The bread came out slightly darker than I'd like. So now I'm always using 't1'. Unless you're eating a Flintstone's-size piece of bread, stay away from the higher settings! The overall toast result is very consistent though. Maybe it's the square heating elements.I haven't used the bake functionality. I'd imagine it to be much like an oven. I referred to the manual before using the broil functionality to cook breakfast links. They took a fraction of the recommendation for a similar meat.Downsides: I'd like to have more realistic toaster controls than not burnt vs. five levels of burnt. Also, the racks don't slide forward by themselves when you open the door. Instead, they are a very tight manual fit. Thus, you always find yourself using a spatula.
Good reusable bottles with caps. Mr. Beer products have never let me down and I know I will enjoy the homebrew hobby for a long time because Mr. Beer makes it easy.

Great idea! This thing is made quite solidly, super easy to put together and adjust to suit your needs. Not wobbly, holds all your cleaning products nicely...spray bottles, liquid dish soap, little bottles of bleach. Great idea! Buy it, you won't be sorry!

I bought this ib spite of the reviews I read, and so far it is working well.  However, I still have black gritty material mixed with the clay at the sides of the rollers even after cleaning them. i just don't use the edges of the clay.
Very nice, not always consist when  making  p0pcorn, But a good  price and a handy top to serve it in.
I have purchased this towel in different colors..this is my fourth purchase..these are actual "bath sheets" as description states..huge!  The terry cloth is a good, heavy quality..love them..

Due our refrigerator's configuration, I needed a dish like this. I can squish three sticks into the dish (wait for them to soften a bit). The glass aspect would be a concern if I had small children. It is heavier (especially) with three sticks of butter in it, than a plastic one. But it is very nice.
I am a super organized person so I love this! It fits in my small kitchen drawer and keeps it looking pristine!
I love this bottle set, which of course matches my Rachael Ray lasagna pan.  I appreciate that the bottles are dishwasher safe and the nozzles are easy to clean.
This fit my rather large toaster oven that I bought from Sams. This will keep the dust off and makes my toaster oven less noticeable which was the goal.
I love Bunns. Very fast coffee. Lasts forever assuming you clean it from time to time. I will always own bunns

This juicer was gift from my boyfriend.It's amazing! it works as advertised. very easy assembly and disassemblyand super easy to clean. It extract juice from almost any kind of vegetable and fruits.Only if you want extract juice from Orange and lemon (all the citrus) you have topeal skin because it will taste bitter.I love this machine because it's very quiet and easy to use and clean and makes very deliciousfresh juice!  Some people find that it's pain in the neck to clean because you have to disassembly the parts but all the parts are easy to take off andyou can clean easily. If you have dish washer,rinse and put the parts in the dish washer.I do really recommend to a person who is looking for commercial quality juicer with reasonable price,this is the one your dream juicer:)

reviewText: I've had this salad kit for several years and it remains one of my favorite bowls for work lunches. It holds a medium to large salad. the freezer tray stays cold until needed at lunch time (much better than some of the other stay-fit freezer lids). I pack it in an insulated bag, but haven't ever needed to include an extra ice pack.The dressing container is the perfect size for dressing.  The trays are on the small side, but unless you really need a super-size salad, this does help with portion control. I've easily packed enough toppings in tray, which have varied from cheese, chopped or cherry tomatoes, sunflower seeds, croutons, broccoli, cauliflower, etc.

I bought this for my daughter, who loves pigs.  She uses it for pancakes and grilled cheese sandwiches, and it always makes her smile.  I don't know whether it's dishwasher safe, because she washes it by hand and stows it away carefully, but it is cute.  It is pretty small, perhaps 5" in diameter.

I absolutely LOVE the quality of Pyrex cookware.  It's nice to have a dish you can cook/bake in and then use afterwards for storage of leftovers.  A few years back I picked upPyrex 6004023 6-Piece Glass Rectangular Storage Set with Blue Lidsfor a steal on Black Friday and that's where my addiction began.  The only thing about that set was that I always wished I had a few smaller pieces for whipping up single dishes or sides.When this 10-piece set came up for half the price as one of Amazon's lightning deals, I jumped at the chance.  Such a great price for excellent quality cookware.  I really like using the three round dishes for making sides and sauces.  The lids snap on air-tight (the first time you put them on might be a bit of a struggle, but they fit perfectly snugly after that).  I use the two rectangular dishes for baking salmon and steelhead in the oven.  They're the perfect size for up to two filets!These dishes and their lids are perfectly dishwasher safe, which is great as well.  They don't take up much room and are the perfect size for single-serving or smaller cooking projects.  This would be great for a college student or someone living alone.  I find them really complimentary to my larger Pyrex set.
summary: A great starter set or addition to your Pyrex collection!

reviewText: I needed something that I could pour boiling hot coffee into and then stick it in the fridge without it breaking.  Since no one seems to make Pyrex pitchers I had to resort to plastic.  I didnt want plastic since I feared it imparting my coffee with a plastic flavor but so far that has not been the case.  Everything tastes fresh and untainted out of these.You should be warned that these are quite tall and may not easily fit in your refrigerator, however it fit in my fridge door perfectly.  Plus with the airtight lid I was able to store these sideways too without any spills though I was a bit frightened of the concept at first, but it all worked out fine.They do feel flimsy like cheap plastic, but upon washing these in pipiing hot water and then rinsing the soap off with cold water, no warping or cracking occurred, so whatever plastic this is made from is made to withstand some pretty severe conditions.  I would highly recommend tossing these into your kitchen drink storing arsenal.I have also never encountered pouring issues with these.  As long as you keep the underside of the spout dry prior to pouring, the liquid will bead right off in a perfect arching waterfall into your cup.  If you're pouring several cups at once, then wipe after each pour or be prepared for a drip here and there.  Thats just the adhesion nature of liquids.

It is very hard to find just the right purple.  Most times it ends up too red.  These are a great shade of purple.  Not too red and not too blue.  The pattern looks better in person.I have tried two other sets of rugs.  I bought one set at Target and they looked really good brand new.  After just a couple times in the washer, they looked bad.  They are now doing gardening duty.  The foam is still great to kneel on.The second set was not a great shade of purple but I kept them anyway.  I figured after a few cycles they would also be tossed.  Unfortunately, they still look great.However, these are much nicer.  I will order more.
I would highly recommend this large skewer fork for anyone who is in the market for one. I love the barbed ends and the comfortable handle. Don't hesitate you will not be disappointed.
If you've ever worked in food service, you've handled one of these. Utilitarian, familiar, functional, easy to clean, fits standard glasses, good durability. What's there to complain about?
summary: does exactly what it's supposed to do

reviewText: I love the feel and look. It doesn't wrinkle as much as some have stated but did anyone else notice that it's larger than tour normal down comforter? I have a lot of excess material hanging. Oh well!

Note:  This mold may be easier to use for candy making than for baking.  For this use, it rates a full five stars.  If you intend to use it for baking, please read further.This Freshware 30-Cavity Silicone Chocolate, Candy and Peanut Butter-Cup Mold is easier to use than the molded plastic variety.  The chocolates pop out (once hardened) without any effort.  Because some reviewers complained about baked good sticking to the silicone surface, I thoroughly read the small users' manual that accompanies the product before using it.The manual states that, prior to its first use, the mold needs to be rinsed in hot water.  (I did that, allowing the mold to completely air dry.)  Then, it needs to be lightly coated with oil, butter, or shortening--only the first time--before using it. Cleaning the mold should not be done with "harsh detergents" and that contradicts the manual's  approval of placing the "...bakeware in the dishwasher."  It also states, "Do not use abrasive cleaners or scouring pads on your silicone bakeware."  Unless you run your dishwasher without detergent, that's just not possible.  If you have already purchased this mold and are having problems cleaning it, refer to the manual for further advice.Even the name of this product is a misnomer.  Nowhere in its title does it imply that it is for use in the oven as bakeware. The manual recommends adjusting recipes (for baked goods) that are low in fat or, high in sugar content to prevent sticking.  Of course, you won't know this until you try baking in the mold.  So, unless you want to do a trial run or, adapt recipes that may stick, I suggest using the mold for candy making.This is one of the molds I'm using to make a large variety of chocolates for a wedding.  Producing about half of the 1,500 confections has made me somewhat of an expert on the subject of candy molds.  I like this mold very much for chocolates.  The fluted lines are crisply detailed, giving my finished products a professional look.  Since I use it only for candy making, I find that rinsing it in very hot water is sufficient for cleaning.  The manufacturer's suggestion of soaking the mold in lemon juice and hot water to rid the mold of odors, prevented me from using it for the chocolates with creme de menthe flavoring.  I didn't want to risk a lingering odor that could be detected in the other varieties.  Since lemon juice would remove the 'slick' coating, I think it would be important to temper the mold once again (as if you were using it for the very first time).Maybe after the wedding I'll try baking in it.  For now, it's a five-stars winner for candy making.
My husband, who fancies himself as "king of the grill," has had this brush for quite a while and it has held up well, so we bought it for my step son too.

Even the best toaster needs help, and these tongs provide a lot.  They are well-designed, proportioned, and safe.  The wood can be safely used to reach into the toaster slots to pull out the English muffin, and the magnet is placed perfectlyl to cling to the side of a range hood.This is one of the few gadgets for which I'll make room in my kitchen.
Great product and works well, once you figure out how to get it on the soda can.  That's not easy.  Watch the customer video, then practice, practice, practice!

What a stylish coffee maker!  I am so pleased with my purchase and would recommend it to anyone.  I debated over which color to go with aqua or yellow and I am so happy with the yellow.  It brightens up my kitchen and is so darn pretty!  I don't find the coffee bitter and I used pre-ground...perhaps if you grind your own beans, you could over-grind them and cause bitterness, the manual does warn against that.  I get 3 cupsworth out of this coffe maker based off of my cup size and amount of milk to coffee ratio. The coffee comes out at a perfect temperature for me.  I add milk and it isn't luke warm after the addition, it is still pleasantly warm.  The reason for 4 stars instead of 5 is the space for the grounds is quite small.  Be very cautious with the amount you add as your filter could floweth over.  I think I am in love!

This does exactly what it is designed for, and the pineapple circles of even thickness are gorgeous. On my first attempt I tried to  keep the shell intact to hold a tiki drink but cut too deep, so depth measurement is essential if this is your goal. And the pineapple has to be just the right size and your aim true- too big and you leave flesh, too small or poor aim and you cut through the side. So if I want rings I use this, if I want chunks I might just use a knife and save the cleanup.

I have not tested to see if they are spill resistant.  It look nice, but is thin not five star.  I did iron it and it ironed well and hung it in the closet with clothes pins instead of the linen closet so it it ready to use when I have unexpected guests.  Always wrinkles if I put it in the linen closet.

This is my first juicer, so I can't really compare it to any other juicer, but I can say that I am impressed with it's easy functionality and ease of cleaning.The juicer was easy to piece together and get up and running after a quick wash.  I was able to make an apple/orange juice for my kids in about 1 minute.  They loved it!  I am now experimenting with juicing vegetables for myself and enjoying the process of experimenting with the different flavors.Cleaning the juicer is pretty easy as the pieces are all wide enough to get a hand and sponge down inside them.  I have read other reviews of different juicers and it was a pretty common complaint about how difficult it is to ensure you get all the little pulpy pieces out, and I haven't had any of those problems with this juicer.The only thing I can come up with as a dislike is that the instruction/recipe book that comes with the juicer is contradictory in some of it's recommendations.  One page says to juice an entire orange, then in another part it says to not juice the entire orange.  But that wasn't a big issue, as I didn't find it difficult to just peel it and quarter it up myself before I dropped it in.

This Winton Decorating Bag Holder is perfect.  Its sturdy and easy to clean.And in case you're thinking that its a waste of money - it isn't.I use several different colors of royale icing at a time when I do cookie pops, and its a pain to keep grabbing mugs or glasses to set them in.  This is so much nicer and takes up less room on the work surface.I don't know why I put off getting this.  Oh, right.  Now I remember - I'm cheap.But this was definitely money well spent.

I have to say these are wonderful.  I love the look and feel of them as well as the wide variety of measurement sizes.  I'd be beyond thrilled if it included a 2 cup size as well alas no luck.  the on criticism i have though is the wimpy little chain link that holds them together. I feel like a nice solid ring would do them better justice.
These filers needed to be trimmed down a little to fit into my machine, but that was easy to do with scissors. The material looks to be better than what came out of there. Price was good too.

I have been looking for covered shakers.  This was as close as I have found to what  I wanted. (a Xmas gift)  I purchased two, one for salt and other for pepper.  They seem to be workable for that as well as for rub. They seem to be of good quality.

The quality of the item is very good- however in the picture of teak finish table it appears much darker than it actually is! Even tho I am disappointed in color I do like the table. Actual color is more like a maple color.

Original review: They're plain & simple & definitely leakproof & the snap vent on the lid makes microwaving possible & safe, the plastic is free of that chemical everyone worries about.  perfect for holiday cooking, storing. the glass gets very very hot if you use for microwaving, so be sure to remove with oven gloves, and remember no plastic in real oven. dishwasher safe too, just beware water fills in the edges of the lids when removing from racks.Update: Beware covers that have been frozen, microwaved, dishwasher-washed contracting, no longer fitting correctly.Accordingly downgraded from 5- to 3-star rating (April 23, 2013.
summary: UPDATED review mostly pefect set of glassware....but, a month later

reviewText: I like how durable they are, not all the lids want to clip on, but over all they work and are good quality!

This was the cheapest item I have ever seen on Amazon. I would not recommend this item for anyone to use. I would have burned it out on the first use. It was so cheap looking and feeling, I sent it back, Never again will I purchase anything like that on line again.

This is a quick boiling, not too noisy water kettle. More and more people are drinking hot tea these days, and in England where there is a kettle in every home, here in the USA ten years ago I couldn't find one anywhere.Transparent fill gauge, cordless and easily lifts off base for use and filling. Internal mesh filter and nice looking it's really great value for the money. It has an auto cut off, which sometimes takes longer than other times to "cut off" but that I think is due to placement of the kettle than anything else.It's stainless steel, NOT plastic so get's hot, I mean burning hot on the exterior - ALWAYS USE THE HANDLE ONLYNot as fast to full rolling boil as some kettles I have owned, but doesn't sound like a steam train either, so I'll take the trade.Easy to use, easy to clean, reasonably priced.

This thing is incredible! You can completely mix a gallon or a quart with this thing in seconds. The bottom half unsnaps and it's good for a quart, or keep the "basket" intact and do a gallon literally in seconds! I use a drill on it's high speed (highest geared) setting and start at the bottom of the can and gently pull up and rotate.I've used 6 year old paint and it was whipped as good as new. When you're done mixing, it's a breeze to clean. Just run it under warm water and spin with a bit of wiping as you go.. A brilliant design.
summary: All I can say is WOW!!!!

reviewText: The marble base is well built, the cut for the wire is just about perfect.You get 2 extra cutting wires, good addition that wasn't mentioned in the product info.I can see where the handle can be a problem.  The handle needs to be adjusted to a specific spot so the wire is straight and tight.  Out of the box, mine was setup wrong.  Not a big deal, and an easy fix.  But I can see that long-term this will be an issue, I'm thinking of putting a dab of lock-tite on the threads to help hold it in place for the lifespan of the wire.Overall, I'd recommend it for a $14-ish slicer.

I bought this to clean out the car floor. Not all that big a job...just dust and normal dirt. No pet hair or anything. No gum wrappers. Just plain old off-the-shoes dirt.As instructed, I charged it for 24 hrs +.Despite that, it did only 1/2 the car before abruptly beginning slow down and to loser power.So I charged it again. For a long time.It lasted only a few minutes and began to slow down again.Its suction is questionable.Even with the little brush attachment to loosen up threads, it never seemed to do the job. Lots of particles remain. I tried it on run-of-the-mill dust and got the same results: not worth doing.The extendable corner wand decreased the suction, and refused to stay extended--so basically it's useless.Worse by far, is that the rotating engine builds a static charge, and periodically "zaps" you though the handle. Not particularly dangerous, not particularly strong, but very particularly annoying.I will be putting this out for a garage sale, and NEVER buy another Black and Decker item again (this is not the first "busted" experience I've had with that brand).

I love this pitcher. It's lasted my a while and the taste of the water is great. The filter lasts roughly 3 months and for the price is great. I do not think Brita can compete with the taste of this PUR water pitcher produces. The plastic of the water pitcher itself is not of the same quality as Brita's, it is not as sturdy but I bought this pitcher because of the quality of the water not the quality of the plastic pitcher but if it was more sturdier PUR would have NO competition.

I have wanted a bread machine for awhile, my husband picked this one because of its rankings on different sites. Easy to clean.I wish they had more recipes.Some of the settings for baking could be easier to follow, as well as trouble shooting.

Bought a second one and that tells the story.....the method of closing off the drinking straw looks to me like it should not last long and would drip....well it does last long, and doesn't drip...keeps water cold and doesn't sweat...how do it know is a mystery.....may buy a third.

We ordered a few placemats from M. Ruskin and have been impressed with them all. The colors in the pictures are vivid and stay bright for - well, it's been over a year now and they are still beautiful! The information is great and the the kids "quiz" each other by holding up the "fill in the blank" side. :-)

My parents are chain smokers who recently got a parakeet (whom they adore). I was concerned about air quality for the little guy so I bought them this and the replacement filters and they keep it running in the room the bird is in and it works great. I suggest changing the filter more frequently than 3 months if you're a smoker. It keeps the room from smelling smokey.
summary: Love it, bought it for a smoking household

reviewText: I love these bags, however I would have preferred the edges be a bit stiffer. They are great for what I needed them for, I put shoes that we only use during the winter in them during the summer, and vice-versa. The shoe one fits under my bed fairly well, even when slightly overfilled. The second one holds all of my collection of T-shirts that I never wear but am too sentimentally attached to get rid of. It keeps them from dust bunnies and any possible insects that might wander into our home. Would love to get more once we get a bigger home!

Most of the negative reviews talk about the condensation that accumulates in cover of the machine. It does but I've learned to live with that since this is my second machine. It makes good coffee and it's cheap. Now if you could find me a good coffee grinder...

These speakers mounts really blew me away once I had them on the wall. I have a pair of Polk M30's in my wall, and I could still do chin-ups on these, they are that solid. That said, the quality of your mount is going to depend on the time you put into it. Step one is to throw the screws they give you in the garbage. I mounted one in plaster walls and did not need a stud, but I used quality expanding drywall anchors to mount these. One side I used the anchors and in the other I hit a stud, so I just used quality wood screws. I would not hesitate to say in a stud these could hold 100lbs all day long. Install took about an hour all told and they look really great. I was going to cheap out on these but I am glad I didn't and I came away with a professional look that really adds to my room.

This product is one of my favorite kitchen dishware pieces.  The bowl is large enough to hold a hearty serving of soup or cereal, or even a pasta dish or vegetables.  The bowl does not stain from foods like spaghetti sauce or beets.  Cooking or reheating in the microwave is easy and effective.  And the blue bowl holder is easy to grasp so you can sip your soup while sitting in your easy chair watching TV.  I love it, and I would recommend it to others.  I will be giving some as gifts to folks like myself who live alone and eat a lot of meals in the living room.

I've tried both the Roomba 560 and the Neato XV-11, and here are my pro's and con's:Pro's:* Neato does a better job *not* slamming into furniture.  Even when it does hit furniture, Neato moves more slowly, so is less likely to shake fragile items onto the floor when it bumps into table legs.* Neato vacuums the floor in a more methodical row-by-row pattern (versus Roomba's method of diagonal turns when it bumps into something), so Neato is more likely to cover the whole area.* Neato didn't move our bath rugs around as much as Roomba.* Neato didn't move its charging base around (versus Roomba that gets stuck to it's charging base if it's not affixed to the wall and pulls the base across the floor).* Neato's dust bin is easier to remove (lifts out from the top, versus having to turn the vacuum upside down).  But you still need to flip it over periodically to clean hair from the silicone beater flaps.* Neato's charging LED can be shut off if desired (instead of serving as a night-light)Con's:* Neato uses a beater brush with silicone flaps instead of a brush.  Dirt seems to stick to the silicone flaps and can scratch up a soft flooring material such as travertine or marble tile (surfaces where you'd normally turn off the spinning brush if you were vacuuming manually)* Neato picks up dust just fine, but it leaves larger items behind (for example bits of leaves that Roomba will pick up).* Unlike Roomba, Neato does not have an edge brush, so it does not clean at all under cabinets or furniture that has an overhang, such as along the front of kitchen cabinets.  It also does not clean edges of the walls as well as Roomba, and that's where dust seems to collect the most.* In my experience, both robotic vacuums stop running before the whole floor is completed.* We didn't like how Neato's tractor wheels dug into rugs and carpet.* Neato does not come with virtual (optical beam) barriers; it does come with magnetic tape that it's not supposed to cross, but I can't imagine sticking that to the floor to keep it out of a particular room.* Because Neato's spinning laser sensor is around 4" above the ground, Neato did not want to clean under a bed with a dust ruffle unless the ruffle was lifted up out of the way.* Both Neato and Roomba vacuums are noisy when operating, like a small regular vacuum.* Neato gets confused by a glossy baseboard finish, causing erratic movement and trouble mapping the room.  (Roomba was somewhat confused by this also, but perhaps not as much since Roomba doesn't even bother trying to map the area [as far as I can tell])I love the concept, but it didn't turn out to be as practical as I would have hoped. Hopefully some of the "cons" above will be resolved in future product generations. Also, it would be cool if the base had a feature where it sucked out the dust into a larger bin so the small bin didn't need to be emptied every day.
summary: Concept is good, but room for improvement

reviewText: I have never owned a kitchen scale. Secretly I have wanted one, but never thought I would actually use it.  I also knew that with our current home (a 100 year old, country home with a tiny eat in kitchen and small (and already full with appliances) counter tops) we really couldn't and shouldn't place one on the counter for fear of losing remaining precious space.  I learned about the Ozeri company a few months ago when I was reviewing their body bathroom scale.  I was blown away by the style, durability of materials, and precision of that scale.  It was a beauty to place in our bathroom and I adore that scale.  It is super easy to read and looks super classy.  When I found out the company had a kitchen scale, I knew I wanted to review it and was so overjoyed when I got the opportunity.  I knew I wanted the kitchen scale to be white. Not only does it match our vintage pink, green and white kitchen, but I always am a fan of white electronic devices. Classy.The Ozeri Digital Kitchen Scale Touch II with Microban Antimicrobial Product Protection comes in black or white and can handle up to 11.2 pounds for weighing food in the kitchen.  It is slim in profile and about 1/2" high. It reminds me of a small ipad or tablet.  It is very easy to store, and is a space saver.  Mine is white with a large blue backlit LCD screen that displays weight in pounds, kilograms, grams, and ounces.  It includes 2 Lithium batteries, which is great because don't we all hate it when we order something, get all excited to use it, then it arrives without batteries and you of course never have the size you need readily on hand?  Other neat features are the low battery and overload indicators.  This scale automatically turns off after 2 minutes of inactivity to preserve battery life.The Mictoban protection is a fantastic aspect of the scale as those who weigh any type of meat/fish would want to take extra care with preventing transfer of salmonella and ecoli, and other nasty germies. (make sure to obviously wipe with disinfectant wipes in between uses as well) The scale is permanently treated with Microban and works for the lifetime of the scale, to maintain surface cleanliness.  According to what I have read recently, bacteria can double every 20 minutes on an unprotected surface...frightening. The Microban is built into the scale, so it does not wipe off. The scale's smooth, sturdy, tempered glass surface is very easy to clean between uses. We usually disinfect everything with Clorox wipes, and this makes it very convenient.  It is nice that there aren't any crevices on the surface where juices or food remnants would hide.It has an automatic Tare button that quickly calculates the net weight of your ingredients by subtracting the container weight, (bowl, tray, plate, sippy cup, etc.) for the net ingredient weight. So you would weigh the container or bowl, scale remembers and sets that to zero, then you would put the food or liquid in the container, and weigh the food in the container without adding weight of container.  This is helpful for those who are on a diet and need to control portions or calories, as well as those who are baking/cooking.  My husband like to buy our hamburger meat / and steak in bulk and then separate it into small packs to freeze, so this is handy for him. Weighing food in recipes means no variations in measurements for accuracy.  Such as if you are putting flour or sugar in a measuring cup and it is tightly packed vs. being in the same measuring cup loosely put in.  The only issue I had when using the tare and on/off button was I would have preferred the on/off button be farther away from the tare button and perhaps a tad bigger.When I was testing this out, I realized the best way to keep things as accurate as possible is to keep the ingredients in the center for consistent reading.  At first I was putting the scale on my vintage red and white pin dot cotton place mats to look artsy for the photos, and then I realized that a few of the times it had the message “unSt”, which at first confused me.  I realized that the scale will detect if it is not on a stable surface and register unSt if the base is unstable.  This was similar to when I tested out the Ozeri body weight scale on my bathroom rug. I weighed considerably less and although I liked that previous weight better, I wanted accuracy so moved it to my bathroom tile and the scale was right on the dot with my accurate weight.  So remember to always use the kitchen scale on a completely flat surface.My most favorite use for this scale is the fact that I can use it to weigh letters and small packages.  I sell a lot of things in my etsy shop (mainly first class and priority in small packages) and this scale is super convenient to have downstairs and not have to go up the somewhat steep steps to weight something in the office.  I am in my third trimester of pregnancy and not a fan of frequent stair climbing. We have a cheapy plastic postage scale that I have had for years that is bulky and plugs into the wall. It is an ugly ole thing in dark blue and takes up space.  I am super happy to be able to use this shiny white, slim, classy and accurate kitchen scale for weighing packages.  The Ozeri scale actually came with a US postal first class rate guide---for sending out packages.  Aren't they clever and so very thoughtful? They already knew I would need it! There is also the owners manual and a super helpful food calorie guide.I really am loving this scale and think that it is made well. It appears to be something that will last a long time and get lots of use.  If you are interested in a kitchen scale or even just a nice postage scale, this may be the product for you.  The surface area of this scale is nice.  When comparing this slim, small profile kitchen scale to my bulkier old postal scale, this scale takes up less room, does not need to be plugged in, and yet has more surface area to weigh my packages while still being able to see the lcd display.I was sent this scale to review in exchange for my honest opinion.  I do not always review products with such positivity.  If I like something it will be known, but if I find issues, or problems with an item, or if I feel improvements need to be made, I will mention them. I feel that reviews of products should always be truthful and sincere, as it helps potentially interested buyers of a product learn what to expect and to see it it is a good fit for them before purchase.  Reviews also help the actual product and company to improve when needed. If you found this review interesting or helpful, please rate it as such, and or comment.  I enjoy writing reviews and like to know if I was helpful.
summary: Honest Thoughts on the Ozeri Touch II Kitchen Scale, and another use for it!

reviewText: I bought two sets of these chairs, four chairs in total, for our kitchen island.  Love the look and sturdiness.  Have held up to large people without issue.  Would buy them again.

reviewText: It arrived quickly and was packaged correctly. But I was disappointed in the quality of the material. They are thin, and even though they are not supposed to move on the floor. I can feel the cold right through them from my tile floors. I had to add more elastic to the one that is supposed to go around the tank. It wouldn't fit otherwise. Overall I would not suggest this to buy to anyone

They wipe off well but you can't soak them in water to really clean them.  I've used red peppers on them and they stain it.  May be alright for some things but wish they could be soaked and wouldn't stain.
