reviewText: I ordered these for my husband when I ordered wine markers for myself. He thinks they're funny and we have received compliments when people are over and we use them. The guys just think they're funny.

I love OXO. I love the design of their stuff, I love the way it feels in my hands and the way it works. So I was excited to try out this set of nesting bowls and colanders. They are color coded so you can quickly stack the right colander with the right bowl. The three sizes are all useful, the largest being perfect for tossing a salad. The lids fit tight, although I'd say the lid for the smallest bowl was "aggressively" tight. It took a few tries to get it on. The other lids fit more easily. This slight glitch might drop a half star on this otherwise perfect set. Great for washing the lettuce, draining, mixing the salad, and storing the leftovers. The rubberized handles and bottoms are a nice additional touch that make this that much easier to use. All in all a great set that I expect to last a good long time.

Never sealed properly.  I really wanted to love this, since we drink lots of carbonated water, and also happen to be homebrewers with large CO2 tanks, but it just didn't work.  Maybe it was just poor manufacturing tolerances on this unit.  I'm fairly sure someone makes the same thing but with an all metal (alu? SS?) body now.  Maybe that's worth trying.
summary: I really wanted to love this, since we drink lots of carbonated water

reviewText: I bought this as a gift to somebody and that person loved it. The best gift ever to a person who loves baking :)

I wanted two tables that didn't take up much room to put on either side of the bed. I did some looking around and found this accent table. It is a true espresso color and works well in a small space. Assembly was pretty easy and did not have any issues putting it together. The small drawer pulls out well and has enough room to store a few books, phone, and other small items. It is light weight but sits well on the carpet.  I know there are higher quality tables out there but if you are looking for a smaller contemporary espresso color table at a great price, this one fits the bill.

I was also skeptical about buying such an expensive can for trash, but I am happy I did.  It looks great in the kitchen with other stainless steel applicances.  The step is easy to push and feels solid.  There is an inner shell that pulls out easily with handles built into the sides.  A regular tall kitchen bag (13 gal.) fits perfectly with any excess bag liner tucked away via a small perforated opening to make a tight seal at the top.  Finger prints on the stainless are easily wiped off.  The hinge in the back is small so it sits close to the wall which is nice.  If this lasts many years, it will be a great buy.
summary: Great trash can for the kitchen

reviewText: After years of using German steel exclusively (I've got a drawer full of Henckels and Wusthof), I received a Shun paring knife as a gift and found it to be the best blade I've ever used.As a dedicated home cook a good knife is probably the most important tool in my kitchen arsenal and I'm slowly adding Shun knives. I recently received this one as a Christmas gift and just adore it.These thin blades are razor sharp out of the box and, while not as easy to self-maintain as thicker German blades, not impossible once you get the hang of it (warning though: these are MUCH easier to knick up if you make a mistake). And while these seem sharper, they don't seem to hold their edge at the pinnacle of sharpness as long as the sturdier German blades.Of the four Shun knives I now own, this is my very favorite and currently the most-used knife in my kitchen, getting almost daily use. I love the deep wide blade that makes cutting a breeze and doubles as scrapper/spatula for transferring just chopped ingredients to a bowl or pan. The handle provides a super-comfortable grip and the knives are always exquisitely balanced (my favorite thing about Shun). They just feel really, really good in your hand and are, therefore, a joy to use.I just can't say enough good things about these knives. I just hope they hold up as well as my Henckels, most of which I've had a decade or more, have.
The bud vase glass inserts work as advertised and are the right diameter.  They seem durable enough and are nicely bottom-heavy.

I wanted a coffee pot without all the extra bells and whistles.  That is what this is.  And I truely love it. Especially for the price.You get what you pay for.  This is a good deal for a Simple coffee pot. L.C.
Very well made, sturdy and ground my herbs very fine. I am satisfied with this product and it came quickly

My wife decided to re-decorate her kitchen in red.  This not only helps do that, but looks great in the kitchen - while performing only as a George Foreman Grill can. I heartily recommend this to anyone looking to brighten their kitchen, as well as cook with a great indoor grill.

First, let me admit it. I love cutting boards. That is, I love good ones. I almost always have one on the counter, at the ready. If I am doing serious cooking I have two, one for meat and one for vegies. I do not like boards that are too big, They are awkward, hard to clean and harder to store.This came about three days ago. Since that time, I have put it through some testing. I have sliced, diced and chopped on it. I have washed it, run it through the dishwasher and set a hot pot on it. The knife does leave some marks on the board. That does not affect its performance at all.  It passed with a rainbow of flying colors.This board does not slip or slide whether the surface is wet or dry. The tomatoes did not stain it. The jalapenos did not leave an odor. I used it side by side with my other favorite cutting board, a polypropylene one with grips that has been a favorite of mine. This one stood up to that test too. I liked it just as much. It has the added benefit of being environmentally-friendly, so seriously, what's not to like?

If you prefer soft butter but need to protect it from spoilage, ants, or even the tongue of a wandering housecat, this is the way to go.  It looks good on the counter, and it works.  I've just ordered a second one, so one will be clean and ready to use as soon as the empty one goes into the dishwasher.

Before you purchase a tamper, make sure you measure the opening of the arm of the machine where you put the espresso. I did so, and this is the perfect size for our espresso machine. The tamper has a nice weight to it, which makes it easy to pack the espresso down for an even shot. It's easy to clean, and continues to look nice and bright after a year of everyday use.
Great product at a great price.  Easy to use and lightweight. I use this one for slicing tomatoes especially since it has the serrated edges.

I was leery about ordering linens over the internet - because what I like in my towels may not be quite what the person writing the review likes!  I tend to be kind of picky with my towels ...  :)I was pleased that my order arrived pretty quickly, and happy to find that the towels were not the size of postage stamps!  I had failed to see if there were sizes listed before ordering and only realized my oversight after having placed the order ... so I was spooked that they'd be tiny.They are a good size!  The body towels are rather generously cut.So I tossed them in the washer and they were very absorbent when the washer was filling up ... that's a good sign, especially when they are brand new!When they came out of the dryer - they were thick and fluffy and SOFT!  They were everything I was wanting.  Thankfully.I like the way they are sewn, nice tight-rolled ends.  Nothing loose and fraying when they came out of the dryer.Overall, I am very pleased with my purchase.  I'll be letting my daughter select one of these sets for her bathroom!!
summary: Purchasing linens without touching them?  O_o

reviewText: My comments about this filter would be the same as I wrote for the other "sister" filter that goes to my IQAir Cleaner machine and I'm very happy to be able to order it online.  Both came fairly quickly and packaged well.
summary: It was exactly what I ordered

reviewText: I own two Bonjour French Press coffee makers.  One is their newer model....it's been perfect.  the other is an older model...their original design that I have had for a long time.  However...this glass carafe no longer fits tightly into the frame.  When I blought them before, they fit perfectly...but for the last two...they fit just a bit loose in the frame no matter how much you tighten the frame.  For this reason I have already accidentally broken TWO...within a month!!!  This is the third one I've ordered....so be careful is my advice...and no I cannot recommend buying this now.
summary: Jury is out on this one.

reviewText: I use a French press coffee and this does not create grounds of the proper size for that.  When set to a larger grind size, which the French press requires, the grounds come out in all sizes, from very fine to pebble sized so I'm returning it
summary: Does not grind properly for French press

reviewText: This was a wedding present, they were thrilled. I have the smaller one of the stand mixer and wish I had this size. The smaller one throws flour around the counter top even with the clear plastic guard.

I have now slept on this mattress topper for 6 nights. I really like this product. I wake up with fewer aches and pains. I now have no left shoulder pain when I sleep on my left side. I also have had no problems with body heat retention or odor. The topper is actually a little thicker than 2.5 inches. I measured it to be just shy of 2.75 inches. My topper did not arrive with an Egyptian Cotton cover but you do not need it. I simply placed the topper on top of my mattress and covered it with my mattress pad and fitted sheet. The topper has not shifted on the mattress in six nights. I highly recommend this mattress topper.
summary: Serta 2.5 inch King Gel-Memory Foam Mattress Topper

reviewText: It is functional, well make and good looking piece. It seems the battery last forever. I am using rechargeable battery. Shipping was fast at not shipping cost.Update: It is still functinal well and it works with my soy mike too. One tip here is have your milk in cool and mixing cup in dry.
summary: I like it and battery last so long

reviewText: I just received my knives and these are by far the best set of knives I have owned.  They are extremely sharp and they are pretty and they feel good in my hand.. The first thing I tried was slicing a piece of paper. WOW!  today I used the Utility knife on a steak at it sliced paper thin with minimum effort.  I am sharing the news of these knives with all my friends.  They deserve the best too..

I was so happy to find an eyelet bed skirt.  Unfortunately, this bed skirt 'ties' on.  The ruffle is not tied to anything except an elastic piece that is supposed to fit around the headboard side of the bed.  I bought a queen size and it is huge.  I had to shorten the elastic and the ruffle still slid around on the sides; drooping or dropping.  The only solution is to take an old sheet and sew it on to the top of the lace (like most bed ruffles) for a good fit.I would not recommend this to anyone unless they know how to sew.
Really useful.  I like that the "business end" detaches from the motor casing for washing.  Stores easily in minimal space.
This makes mincing fresh herbs into teeny pieces so easy.  And because it comes apart the clean up was also very easy.
Larger than I anticipated, but very sturdy, attractive for transporting cakes, casseroles and other party foods to a Party.Stores nicely in its collapsed State.

I've looked at a few digital thermometers both online and in-store.  Most of 'em look cheap and feel cheap....especially the ones with the folding jackknife probe.  I've also seen $9.99 digital thermometers advertised at $24.99 online from 'reputable' retailers - brand loyalty only goes so far, eh?I felt that this thermometer had more credible reviews from people who use a digital thermometer in their professional protocol.  It's built well, the cover snaps on securely (no slop), the pocket clip is tight and the temperature readings are very responsive.  It comes with a battery installed AND they even give you an extra battery with this thermometer.  Impressed.

Ok.. I have to say that this pot is a fantastic add to your kitchen collection.  It makes making dinner a pleasure.  Stuff doesn't stick to it and it has high sides so food doesn't end up on the stovetop like it does with a skillet.The finish of this dutch oven is high quality.  It is definitely worth the price.. very comparable to a Le Creuset.. at a fraction of the cost.

I filled these adorable containers with sauces: siracha, soy sauce, sweet chilli sauce, and even balsamic vinegar! The filled bottles went into a zip bag in the fridge ready to grab and go. Best way to fill them is to pinch them and suck-up your soy, chilli, or vinegar. My siracha bottle has a small squirt spout just the right size to fill a piggy. If I come across a tiny funnel some time in the future I will snap it up to make the job easier.  I am glad I bought them and look forward to all the versatility of flavor I will have in my lunch box.

This is a fantastic alternative to leaving my coffee in bags for any longer than a few days. It definitely keeps the coffee fresh. It's great for when I go on trips to the West Coast and pick up some Stumptown or Four Barrel to bring home.

I use them to make an "overnight oats" batch and keep it in the refrigerator. Perfect size to have for breakfast, match it with bernardin plastic mason jar caps (need to buy separately) and you've got a breakfast to-go!*Buyers please note: These do not come with caps! I repeat - do not come with caps!
I haven't used it yet, but looks like it would be a great asset to my kitchen.

reviewerName: Lettetia "As Long As I Am Able To Read, I Sha...
reviewText: The Anysharp Knife Sharpener is just what is described on the package.  Ease of use, smooth and even sharpening of most blades, and the convenient suction cup base make this an essential part of my kitchen from now on.

I purchased the Simplehuman trash/recycler at Williams Sonoma for $189.08 March 18, 2012.  This included the can $159.95, tax $11.54, and shipping/process charges $17.59.This is the best trash can I've ever owned.  I purchased the trash/recycler can combination in the fingerprint proof stainless steel model.  The can is excellent for single persons or couples.The can holds two separate plastic canisters for the trash and recycling--gray and blue.  Each canister holds approximately 5.3 gal. each.The can has a step on mechanism that activates the butterfly cover that is not fingerprint proof.  It is made of shinny stainless steel. This cover works so well you never have to touch it.Please pay careful attention to the positioning of the plastic canisters because they have a very specific orientation that allows the butterfly cover to close properly--all by itself.This is also a work of art that works well with other stainless steel appliances.  It certainly complements the decor. I love this can!  It has made my life so easy.You will receive 3 free can liners/trash bags with your initial purchase.You can also order special liners/garbage bags that fit perfectly with each canister, or you can use your typical 5 gal. trash liners/bags.If you decide to use regular 5 gal. trash liners/bags, they will require some manuevering to get them to stay in place.Pros:Auto closure3-Free trash liners/bagsFabu designFunctionalEasy accessSort trash/recyclingBlocks food odorsConceals food stuffsEasy to cleanFingerprint proofEasy to storeHigh quality stainless steelHigh quality designSits flat agains the wallFlatters decorSleek/Modern designState of the art technologyDurable10-Year warrantyCons:May not be suitable for large familiesFrequent emptyingMay not be suitable for small apartments/condosSpecial liners/bags required (optional)
summary: Simplehuman - Fingerprint Proof Butterfly Stainless Steel Trash/Recycle Can

reviewText: I love my juicer.  It's very easy to clean and use. It didn't come with any recipes but you can look online for those.

First a great price to begin with, and very easy assembly. Finish is very nice, deep walnut look.No blemishes. Only took about 30 minutes to assemble. Great packaging, no damage during shipment. Baskets are sort of cheap feeling, but, the quality of the bench makes up for it, I'd rather have a better bench and cheap baskets than the other way around. Although meant to sit on to remove shoes, if you're a huge adult, it'll hold you, but why push it. For kids, it's fine. Very good size too,,,,for the price and value. I'd order again.
i have received the item but have not had a chance to use it yet. but looks good and i hope that the food doesn't get stuck like it has happen to others

We have owned our Krups 404-70 for over twelve years and absolutely love it.  As mentioned in some reviews, it took a few tries to get the hang of getting the opener to connect to the can, but other than that, this opener is flawless.So easy to clean, doesn't take up much space, leaves you with cans and lids that do not have sharp edges, leaves you with a can that will not scrunch when you are holding it.I dread the day when our opener quits because I cannot find a new one, esp. at the great low price of less than $30 that we paid for this one.KRUPS or Leapy Lee -- are you listening?  Please bring this opener back -- there are several customers out here who need, want, or will need another!  :-)
summary: I hope Krups brings this can-opener back on the market

reviewText: I have replaced the decanter twice in the last year.  It is definitely fragile as just slight bump will create a crack.  I have had Cusinart coffee maker for five years and the decanter never broke.  At the rate of replacement I can buy myself a new coffee machine.

I read lots of reviews on a lot of different woks and finally settled on this one.  It really does a great job for stir fry and it's a great value for the money.I like that this wok is not too heavy which is helpful when you have a lot of food in it that naturally makes what you're having to hold a lot heavier.  The lid is even lighter and there's not much substance to it, but it does its job perfectly.  I even use the lid on other things that I'm cooking at the same time since it's so big it fits over all my other pots and pans.One tip when you're attaching all the handles: there was no instruction reminding me what the finished product looked like so I couldn't figure out where the wood handle for the lid went until I had to use the lid about 2 dinners later...I realized I had no way to pick up the hot lid and I finally figured out what to do with the leftover wood nub sitting in my drawer. LOL!The one thing I still haven't figured out is how to properly season this thing.  The Q&As; and reviews would have you believe that watching a simple video will teach you the trick, but for me it has not.  I've taken extra great care in following "seasoning" instructions, but to no avail.  Instead I've just been developing gunk at the bottom of the wok and the pan is not turning black like I thought it would.  Maybe that only applies to seasoning cast iron and not steel.  I don't know, but if you're not worried about the seasoning, you'll be pleased with this wok.  It holds a TON of food.  I've put in 2-3 lbs of chicken, head of broccoli, carrots, 4 squash/zucchini, 8 oz mushrooms and then some and have room for everything to cook in this wok.  I now use this instead of my other "flat" pan all the time simply due to the size.If you're a novice cook who just wants to be able to do stir fry, then this wok is certainly worth getting.

You will need these if you're buying a sodastream for the first time. Exactly like the one they provide you with with most Sodastream machines this allows you to make 3 liters so that you don't have to constantly refill your one bottle. Great for company too!

I have had this coffee pot for about 5 years now and love the way it works. I was "raised" on perk coffee and think that drip coffee tastes oily and bitter, and cold. I am building a retirement house in the Philippines, and wanted another pot for that location. For those who complained about drip marks on the exterior surface I have this answer. You were never in the military! All things need to be polished to include stainless steel. Rub the EXTERIOR with a little "Mothers" polish once in awhile and it will gleam better than new. Me-n-Yosemite Sam will be sitting around the kitchen table for many years to come. And for those who wonder about the differences in the advertised Farberware coffee pots--this is the smaller pot, not a "cheaper" version. Thank you again Amazon, for saving me gasoline, and frustration by stocking products that are available nowhere else.
summary: Great pot. Second one I bought.

reviewText: Should have ordered 2, because grand children love grandpa's deviled eggs. Haven't tried the other parts of the tray but the deviled egg holder is great.
Meatloaf comes out great if you use pam on it first. It is ease to clean. If I ever need another one I would buy it.
So batteries don't last forever, but my roomba should.  I needed a new battery and she is off and working on cleaning my house!

After buying wash cloths that were scratchy, these were soft and absorbent as described. Felt good on the skin and laundered nicely with just a minimum of shrinkage as to be expected. Very happy with the price! Thanks.

I just bought these and was so pleased when they arrived. I like the Kitchen Aid brand as it is, but these were a perfect purchase for me. The set filled out my missing utensils and are a handsome addition to my kitchen.They feel robust and well made and it is an excellent selection for a starter set or even as a later addition to your regular kitchen utensils.For the price you get pretty much most of what you are going to need for every day cooking. Well worth the purchase!
I bake a lot so the three set worked out great for me. Now I can mix multiple icings at once.

I have always been a fan of mini loaf pans for baking banana bread in, so I took a chance and have been pleased.  Pliable from freezer to the oven, easily washable and pliable enough to push any stubborn loaves out of the pan instead of having to get a knife or fork to help get those out. The jury's still out about having to oil or not, but I don't think that it would be bad either way.All in all, a good buy.
summary: Who doesn't like silicone baking items?

reviewText: Great product, is holding up very well. Accurate and nice to have 2 sizes in one tool. Very happy with this

I've had one of these for years. Still as firm as the day I got it and I use it most every day for laying on the couch or the floor or propped up reading. I tried it for sleep but it is too high for that unless you have very wide shoulders maybe for sleeping on your side. But as a neck/head support to use in addition to whatever pillow/cushion you are already using, it is excellent. Good support and keeps your head weight off your neck which is pretty much the whole idea of support. I paid about 1/2 of what I see here but I chose a blue paisley print that obviously was not considered 'popular'. You will notice that their prices vary according to material print. how silly. The one I got is a cotton fabric and I loved it so much I got 2 but have not had to use the 2nd one yet as this one has kept its shape and firmness for years. Kinda bulky for travel and I think it would push your head too forward in any kind of 'bucket style' seat like an airplane but for home use when laying around it can't be beat. It can handle being scrunched on bad angles too (in the name of comfort). It always springs back to the full bone shape. While good neck support, I would not consider this a 'cervical' pillow. It is a good 6" in the middle and firm. Supports the lower portion of your head in addition to the neck. At least for me.

I love this pot, I use it more than any other. It's perfect particularly for sauces or gravies or anything involving a roux because the wisk can get into the corners (something that, ironically, one can't do with a so-called "sauce" pan). It heats evenly, has a nice weight (which you'll want if you cook; if you don't cook and want light, get Mirro), never sticks (if it sticks for you, your heat's up too high), and it's easy to clean (though occasionally you'll need to use Bar Keeper's Friend). One can also "flip" with it.The handle, unfortunately, is the same sort of handle used by all the higher-end cookware manufacturers these days and is too rounded, when it should be more flat (like what you find on very old iron pans). This can create problems if you're trying to pour or drain using only one hand (the handles on the old Magnalite were near-perfect).All things considered, though, if my house were burning down, this is the first pan I'd grab.
summary: Love the Pot; the Handle, Not So Much

reviewText: I was hesitant to spend this much money on a thermos, but I went ahead and bought it because it was one of the only models without toxic non-stick coating on the interior. I'm really glad I did!I brew 32 oz of green tea from loose leaves each morning at 6am and put it into the thermos to drink throughout the day. At 6pm, when I get home from work, I usually still have a little left, and it is still steaming when I pour it out. I once left my tea in the thermos overnight and in the morning it was still hot enough to drink. The lid seals really well, and I have had no issues with leaking.My only complaint is that the lid is a little difficult to clean, but once a week I soak it in a mixture of white vinegar and water for about 15 minutes, and then use a Q-Tip to clean all the hard-to-reach spots. At the same time, I fill the thermos with a mixture of hot water and baking soda, and that cleans the inside really well. I don't soak the lid in baking soda because baking soda always leaves a little residue behind and I wouldn't want that to mess up the lid's seal. I put only plain tea into the thermos (nothing that will spoil or stink), so I think it's fine to just rinse it out at night and deep-clean it once a week.
summary: I can still drink my tea 24-hours later

reviewText: Except for my old Revere stock pots (25+ years) when they were well made, I have all All-Clad -- Stainless and nonstick pans/pots.  Love my stainless (no problems).  My nonstick -- don't love so much.  In fact, I just bought a 12" T-Fal which works beautifully, for one-fifth of the price.Though All-Clad has a lifetime warranty on their products, they make you jump hoops, including monetary, to just "analyze" your pan, before they even think of fixing or replacing.  To me, that is just WRONG.  A Manufacturer should back up its product - PERIOD.They include "high heat" as one of the non-fixing points, but according to their description -- the non-stick can handle up to 500 degrees.  My stainless can handle the oven or broiler.  I wouldn't think of putting a non-stick under a broiler, but to the novice.... they do not warn.I have been cooking a long time.  Never would I use a stainless steel utensil on a non-stick, nor would I throw it into the dishwasher... though, on All-Clad's website, which I just checked today, it has an icon that says that the non-stick is "dishwasher safe".  Hmmm...My latest 10" non-stick, that is headed to the garbage bin, was bought at All-Clad's semi-annual sale at the Washington County Fairgrounds (1/2 hour out of Pittsburgh, PA), three years ago.  (To All-Clad junkies, this is a sale you cannot pass up -- in June & December each year.)  It stopped being non-stick about 1 1/2 years ago.  Why do I keep holding onto it -- it's ALL-CLAD.  But I see a 10" T-Fal in my future.In summary -- if you want non-stick, go for a T-Fal pan.
summary: Second pan headed for the garbage bin

reviewText: I bought these because I cannot use my cherished iron skillets on my new ceramic top stove. And they were such a good price, 2 for the price of one. However, I was put off a bit by the color.Actually the pans are rather attractive, cook well, brown well. I have a lot of circulon and I like these better.You won't be sorry that you bought these.

The product arrived in good condition.  Packed very securely.  The color of this product is beautiful and will go easily from oven to table.  I have loved all the Rachael Ray products I have purchased.  Would make a great gift.

This thing is awesome!  I don't like the clutter of a counter top knife block, or the visual clutter of a wall mount.  This thing tucks in the drawer and holds all of my good knives in a safe, non-damaging way.  And my ceramic hone fits perfectly in the middle slot.  It's also a great deal price-wise!  If you spend money on knives, this is a no brainer!  I have several different types of European and Japanese blades, they all fit beautifully with no problems.  What impresses me the most is that this fits so many knives in a remarkably small space.  I would recommend this to anyone who has high quality knives in the kitchen!

I'm normally good about reading descriptions... but somehow I missed that the large chef knife was just a litte biddy thing... Luckily for me, this happens to be my preference in knife sizes.  The wood handles do need occasional oiling, no biggie there.  I mainly bought the set for the 8 steak knives and am very pleased... and since was a sale item, it was defiantely cheap enough to be worth it.

I've been using the Hamilton Beach FlexBrew for about two and a half weeks now, and have had pretty good results.First, some context: I'm sort of a coffee snob, but not a die-hard one. I know what goes into brewing good coffee, know the difference in quality between drip and a French Press, own a burr grinder, etc. My last machine was a DeLonghi super-automatic espresso maker that I used for Americanos, but it's currently in need of maintenance so I picked this up as an inexpensive and convenient interim option. I really wasn't expecting much, but I've been pleasantly surprised.The elephant in the room: first time I tried grounds in it, it barfed them all over the counter. What a bummer. But then I found the second basket insert that they now include in the revised version. Keep in mind most of the bad reviews on here were before February when they started including this. With the basket insert I've had no problems with overflow or grounds in the cup.The coffee quality is good, but not great at 2 Tbsp / 10 oz of water, medium grind, which is what Hamilton Beach recommends as the max. Unfortunately, it comes out a little weak that way, so I wasn't wholly happy with the results.I've played around with both grind and amount, and have found that the maker works best with 3 Tbsp / 10 oz, which is closer to the classic brewing recommendation of 2 Tbsp / 6 oz. You do need to mind the grind and keep it squarely medium, as this nearly tops up the grounds insert; if you grind too finely, water will overflow. At this strength, the coffee has a bit of body to it, and is quite drinkable.I also tried a finer grind at the 2 Tbsp recommended max, but that just made it drip slower without actually extracting much more flavor. That's counter-intuitive to me, but there's no question that the results were inferior to 3 Tbsp/medium grind. So, using more coffee seems like the way to go.It is worth noting that the machine has a shower-head for evenly delivering water into the grounds, rather than just a straight drip into the basket. That actually surprised me, as cheap machines sometimes do not have this. The FlexBrew does a pretty good job saturating the whole grounds basket, and I was never concerned that it only extracted through the middle.As a K-Cup machine, it's adequate. It's quite a bit slower than a genuine Keurig, without the flavor being noticeably better. It's also kind of a pain to clean out the residue of some of the more viscous drinks, like cocoa or chai, and having to completely swap out the grounds basket for the K-Cup receiver is a little more painful than using a My K-Cup style insert like most other machines. However, the larger grounds basket does give you more flexibility on how much coffee you use. Overall, I'd say this is a better grounds-based maker than K-Cup maker, now that they've fixed the overflow issue.A minor problem is splashing. The cup platform has two positions: completely down and way up high. Up high, it won't fit anything bigger than a standard mug, but does OK getting water in the cup with some minor splatter onto the machine. But if you use any sort of tall or travel mug, you'll need to use the bottom position. There, the water falls far enough to splatter on the counter around the machine. I put a stack of rubber coasters on the cup platform to raise my mug up and that largely fixed the problem, but it's a bit of a workaround. It'd be nice if the platform were more adjustable.The biggest dig is capacity: water maxes out around 10 oz, though you might be able to push it -slightly- higher, which means 8-9 oz after absorption and steaming off. I ended up buying a 10 oz mini travel mug for it, but it would be nice to be able to fill a more typical 14-16 oz mug. But no surprises there: it's a single-cup maker, and it means it. Don't buy it expecting anything else.Now that I have strength dialed in, I'd call it 4.5 stars as a single-serve grounds-based coffee maker and 3.5 stars as a Keurig machine. So, that's four stars average and a positive recommendation if all you want is a cup at a time. I'm happy with this machine.

Like many others here, I got this to go with my larger-size stand mixer, in my case a Pro 600. The Pro is great but you pay for the large capacity by its being less useful for very small batches of things. Enter the 3-qt Combi Whip combination - half the size, just right and seemingly engineered to make up the gap. I got it to make quick work of beating egg whites and cream.Unfortunately, it doesn't work. Both the bowl and the whip are well made, but they don't fit together - the beater doesn't reach the bottom of the bowl. This specially sized beater was made specifically to fit this smaller, more shallow bowl, but it's been machined a tad too short. The result is that your cream or egg whites will sit in the bottom of the bowl and not whip, no matter what. They're just not getting enough contact.I'm not the only one posting this problem, and another commenter here is replying to other complaints with directions on how to adjust the beater clearance at the back of the bowl arm. Well, no; adjusting the beater clearance is not a reasonable solution. If your clearance is just right for the large bowl, you don't want to mess with it just to whip a bowl egg whites and then have to adjust it right back to continue using the large bowl. Clearance, once precisely adjusted, should be left alone. If an extra attachment requires 2 instances of beater clearance adjustment each time just to use it, there is a problem.Too bad, because it's a great idea. I gave it 2 stars instead of 1 because it might work ok for thicker doughs, even if it can't do whipping. Since some folks here are happy with it, I'm guessing they're using it for cookie doughs and cake batters, and that's great. (You can't knead bread dough with this item.) But whipping is what I wanted it for, so I didn't get to throw away my hand mixer after all.
summary: a great idea that doesn't do what it's advertised to do

reviewText: I use this almost exclusively for preparing homemade french fries.  I like to blanch my fries before deep frying and this has helped cut initial prep time down to a few minutes.  The result is individual fries of consistent size that cook at the same speed.
These tumblers are perfect in several ways. Big enough to put ice AND a whole can of pop into, plus they are non-breakable. The colors are all nice, too. Great value- and shipped super fast.

This "Toddy Brewing Container with Handle" does exactly what it's suppose to do....makes great cold brewed coffee.  I've seend some comments about the handle being a problem. I sure wouldn't try to pick up the container when it's full of liquid without supporting it with my other hand.  If used with common sense, you shouldn't have a problem.
summary: Does What It Was Created To Do

reviewText: Strong, sturdy and functional - what else do you need to know.  It'll be around for years to come. excellent choice.

I am very pleased with this vacuum. I was replacing a similar vacuum from Kenmore. This one looked comparable, which is why I chose it. It is powerful and easy to operate. The door containing the tools is a bit stiff, initially I wasn't sure it opened. I am not bothered by this as the tool door of the Kenmore was very loose and sometimes the tools fell out, that was more inconvenient. This is a good vacuum for the money. I looked a Kirby vacuums which were four times as expensive, are so heavy it's hard to use them, and do not have the convenience of a retractable cord.
summary: It sucks - in a good way!

reviewText: I bought this to keep coffee beans fresh in. It works! It's very sturdy and of nice quality. It is slightly smaller than I had hoped, but it turns out to be a convenient size.

I am the type of person who would prefers having their food stick to a surface rather than having it not stick but be exposed to carcinogens and all sorts of other chemicals that I don't know about. I searched for this stainless steel rice cooker. The rice is in contact with steel, not teflon. If I only remembered to add a little vegetable oil to the water and rice, then I'm sure that it wouldn't stick to the bottom as much or not at all. And in even in the worst case, it takes a little scrubbing to get the caked on food off.The rice cooker itself works very well. I cooked quinoa in it the other night and it cooked it perfectly. It automatically switches from cook to warm based on the amount of water that is put in. It cooks fast.
summary: Rice sticks but there are no carcinogens!

reviewText: This vacuum has excellent suction. And the canister empties easily and fits well. But the exhaust is in the FRONT, so that everything you intend to pick up gets blown into the air. Absurd design. It's also a bit heavy to be considered a lightweight and is very cumbersome and difficult to maneuver.

There are some thoughtful details about this cutting board that I really like:  a rim that keeps it from sliding around, a lip at both the side and back that discourages chopped items from hopping off the board, a gap at the corner (between the lips) to let you easy slide chopped items into a bowl or pot.  I'm not crazy about the fact that cutting on it leaves incisions in the board where bacteria will have opportunity to multiply, but I've yet to find a cutting board that satisfies me on that point.  All in all it's a fine product.
these are nice thick plastic and dont melt when you put em in the microwave the easy find lids are pretty awesome too.
This popper does exactly what it's suppose to do. The only reason I did not give it 5 stars is because of the noise.

bought them back around March. Out of 12 jars I have 6 left. They seem to have a week spot in the glass. The 6 that have cracked have done so in the same area, even the cracks follow the same path. I have off brand jars also, that have never cracked on me. These jars do not take the heat well for canning. I find the cracks on inspection when I pull them out of the hot water. Yes I know how to can, so this is not a user issue. After buying I also found this name brand and off brand jars in almost every store from hardware stores to discount stores for 1/2 the price of these. I also found that Ball plastic lids fit all glass jar brands (I use the plastic lids for my yogurt making). Ball does have a good product, just not this group of jars. I think I will stick to my Off Brand jars, that have lasted me for over 6+ years.

I am a female senior citizen and this is the worst toaster I ever bought.  If you haven't seen my review on the white toaster, this is only a different color.  It does not toast the bread right.  And, there are lots of places on the toaster top where crumbs can collect inside.  Buy something else.
summary: I Hate To Give It One Star

reviewText: This toaster is very light, so when you press the lever down to push the bread down to toast, you need to hold the toaster in place with your other hand or it will go flying across the counter. Also is, for some strange reason, difficult to plug in. I'm trying to remember to unplug it when it's not in use, and the plug/unplug process is a pain because the plug is very tight. It also gets very very hot on all the metal parts. When the toast is done, it never pops up high enough to get it out, and a few times i burned my finger tips badly while trying to hold this light toaster in place while trying to dig out the toast which is just below the top of the toaster and cannot be easily grabbed. Who designed this thing? I'm glad i don't have to make toast in the broiler anymore, but i'm also sure this toaster is not going to last very long. It was a mistake to buy this one.
The insulated food flask is very good. Nothing extraordinary, just good enough for my purposes which is to carry hot food to work.  I would recommend it to anyone who needs a container that size.

I have 2 Black and Decker CitrusMate Plus Juicers; one for each of my homes.  One house is in Florida, so the juicer gets lots of use since we have orange trees.  It is not an expensive item, but works great.  I have given 2 as gifts and recommended them to Florida neighbors. Everyone loves this juicer, and they are easy to use and clean. I also use them for making lemon and lime pies.
I love this set because they were all different colors.  I used for my daughters bridal tea party and everyone loved.
